Class TmlHttpJson

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.viise.zhurnal.tml.TmlHttpJson
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Template, TemplateNamed

    public final class TmlHttpJson
extends java.lang.Object
implements TemplateNamed
    HTTP template as a JSON.

      • TmlHttpJson

        public TmlHttpJson(java.util.regex.Pattern pattern,
                   java.lang.String tmlStr)
        Ctor.
        Parameters:
        pattern - Pattern for parsing tmlStr. pattern must not be null.
        tmlStr - Template as a String. To create it's recommended to use TmlHttpJson implementation. If tmlStr is null, then default value is empty.

        Ctor.
        Parameters:
        pattern - Pattern for parsing tmlStr. pattern must not be null.
        tml - Template implementation. It's recommended to use TmlHttpJson implementation. If tmlStr is null, then default value is empty.

      • TmlHttpJson

        public TmlHttpJson(Template tml)
        Ctor.
        Parameters:
        tml - Template as a String. To create it's recommended to use TmlHttpJson implementation. If tml is null, then default value for tmlStr is empty.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public java.lang.String create()
        Creating template {"http":{"endpoint":"endpoint_value","method":"method_value","status":"status_value"}}, where endpoint_value - endpoint value from tmlStr, method_value - method value from tmlStr, status_value - status value from tmlStr. Example: 
         
 String tml = TmlHttpJson(new TmlHttp(HttpMethod.GET, "/users/1", HttpStatus.OK)).create();
 // This code creating template:
 // {"http":{"endpoint":"/users/1","method":"GET","status":"200 OK"}}
        If pattern is null, then pattern is generated like this: 
             1. Get HttpMethod.names and added in Method group. Example: [HTTP <METHOD:(GET|PUT|POST|DELETE)>.
     2. Added in pattern endpoint group: <ENDPOINT:((?:/?[A-Za-z0-9$.+!*'(){},~:;=@#%_\-]*)+)>
     3. Added in pattern status group: <STATUS:([\d]+ [A-Za-z\- ]+)>].
     The resulting pattern is something like this ("something like this" because all HTTP methods for readability
     are not listed):
  [HTTP <METHOD:(GET|PUT|POST|DELETE)> <ENDPOINT:((?:/?[A-Za-z0-9$.+!*'(){},~:;=@#%_\-]*)+)> <STATUS:([\d]+ [A-Za-z\- ]+)>]
        If tmlStr does not match pattern, then method return {"http":{"endpoint":null,"method":null,"status":null}}.
        Specified by:
        create in interface Template
        Returns:
        template as a JSON String.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name()
        Name of class template.
        Specified by:
        name in interface TemplateNamed
        Returns:
        "http".
